forkee.description: Universal dependency update tool that fits into your workflows.

issue.title: feat: add option to use git-credentials file instead of token
issue.body:
Reference https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/discussions/25303

## Changes

- add a config parameter `platformGitCredentialsFile` for whether use token or `.git-credentials` file, default to token, like the current behaviour
- add it as parameter of methods `getRepoUrl` and `initRepo` of platform gitlab

<!-- Describe what behavior is changed by this PR. -->

## Context

This PR helps when a gitlab has configured something on the 443 port, like kerberos, and so hides the classic HTTPS authentifaction

Using the `.git-credentials` file it works, but it needs that the token isn't given throught the URL

## Documentation (please check one with an [x])

- [ ] I have updated the documentation, or
- [x] No documentation update is required

## How I've tested my work (please select one)

I have verified these changes via:

- [x] Code inspection only, or
- [ ] Newly added/modified unit tests, or
- [ ] No unit tests but ran on a real repository, or
- [ ] Both unit tests + ran on a real repository



There was no tests on `getRepoUrl` and if there should be one I don't know how to mock `hostRules`

comment.body:
> then please check the corresponding boxes inside the PR description.

I have validated the git behaviour, not the renovate one YET

comment.body:
@rarkins i am testing it on the problematic gitlab but I have an issue 

I have moved the configuration from initplatform to initrepo as git is not initialized before 


The issue I have is : where do I write the git-credential file ? 

Either in ~/.git-credential but the home of who? 
Either in the renovate base dir? I can tell git where the file is specifically

comment.body:
Hi @viceice, we installed the renovatebot app directly in github, how can we know which version is being used and where can we track that?
Asking because a change like mentioned here https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/issues/23326#issuecomment-1662967088 might cause a breaking change for us eventually
Many thanks

issue.title: Optimize NPM package manager with dedupe option
issue.body:
### Discussed in https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/discussions/25455
Originally posted by **jelhan** October 26, 2023 ### Tell us more. NPM package manager with `npmDedupe` option is not very performant. I run into timeouts with my project. When looking into why it takes so much longer with deduplication, I noticed that the implementation could be improved. Currently it does the following if `npmDedupe` is in `postUpdateOptions`: 1. Run `npm install` _without_ the `--package-lock-only` flag. This causes all packages to be downloaded and a `node_modules/` folder being created. Very time consuming. https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/blob/3df10279cd3422c0ff815f37d8d6870105929462/lib/modules/manager/npm/post-update/npm.ts#L54-L63 2. Run `npm dedupe` as a second step. https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/blob/3df10279cd3422c0ff815f37d8d6870105929462/lib/modules/manager/npm/post-update/npm.ts#L132-L136 Two optimizations are possible: 1. `npm install` can deduplicate the dependencies directly with the `--prefer-dedupe` flag. Instead of `npm install --no-audit && npm dedupe` we can do `npm install --prefer-dedupe`, which is much faster. 2. No need to download and install the packages for deduplication. `--prefer-dedupe` and `--package-lock-only` flags are working well together. The performance difference is huge. `npm install --prefer-dedupe --package-lock-only --no-audit` is finished within 1 second on my test project while `npm install --no-audit && npm dedupe` takes minutes. _Note: Converted from bug report in #25454 to this feature request._

comment.body: new method can only be used for npm v7+

```suggestion
      update.groupSlug = `minor-${update.newMajor}.${update.newMinor}-${update.groupSlug}`;
```
simplify, numbers are allowed in string template

pull_request.title: feat: separateMultipleMinor
pull_request.body:
## Changes

Attempt at supporting the `seperateMultipleMinor`

* added logic to adjust branch topic when enabled
* added logic to pull all minor versions to buckets when enabled

Will follow up with one for patch also when/is this is merged

## Context

My usecase is seperating eks versions as individual prs as they are "minor versions" but you must go 1 by 1 during an update

- closes #6576

## Documentation (please check one with an [x])

- [x] I have updated the documentation, or
- [ ] No documentation update is required

## How I've tested my work (please select one)

I have verified these changes via:

- [ ] Code inspection only, or
- [ ] Newly added/modified unit tests, or
- [ ] No unit tests but ran on a real repository, or
- [x] Both unit tests + ran on a real repository

below is it run for my exact usecase happy to try others if suggested

https://github.com/phyzical/renovate-tester/pulls

It works for my tiny usecase.

but I think ive done this wrong though... as i felt like i was fighting the ```{{#if separateMinorPatch}}{{#if isPatch}}``` logic so open to feedback

i also couldn't find an example of `separateMultipleMajor` being run from a multiple branch test context, there just seems to be hardcoded tests against static templates. or have i not looked hard enough

Thanks!

issue.title: feat(presets): add tamagui monorepo
issue.body:
<!-- If this is your first pull request: sign the CLA with this GitHub app: https://cla-assistant.io/renovatebot/renovate -->
<!-- Make sure the `Allow edits and access to secrets by maintainers` checkbox is checked on this pull request. -->
<!-- Please read https://github.com/renovatebot/renovate/blob/main/.github/contributing.md before you create your pull request.-->

Adds https://tamagui.dev/ to the list of monorepos.

release.short_description_html:
37.34.0 (2023-10-27)
